page.title: 06Rhenigidale Postman
page.content: There is no Post Office nor any shops in Rhenigidale.There is a Post Box near the school on the main path into the village. It is a small red post box hanging on a wall. The postman is my uncle Mr Kenneth Mackay. He has to walk to Tarbert and back on Tuesdays , Thursdays and Saturdays to get the mail. He has to carry all the mail and any daily newspapers or magazines in his post bag. If there are any urgent supplies needed then he will carry them also. The walk from Rhenigidale to Tarbert takes the postman about 2 hours. If the weather is icy, snowy or very wet it will take longer. Perhaps once or twice a year he may have to put his journey off until the following day due to adverse weather conditions like a blizzard or gales, as the path is quite exposed.
